### Task: Explore your own files using the terminal

# Accessing the cluster

## Log into your account

```{bash, eval = F}
ssh usr123@abacus
```

##Create a new directory in your home directory

```{bash, eval = F}
mkdir ~/workshop
```

## Change your password

```{bash, eval = F}
passwd
```

# Moving files to the cluster

## Task: make an R script

In your computer open an R session make an R script

```{r, eval = F}
Sys.sleep(20)
message("my first job in the cluster")
```

## Move it to the cluster

In your computer

```{bash, eval = F}
scp ~/path_to_sript/r_script_name.R usr123@abacus:~/workshop 
```

## Modify the R script

In abacus

```{bash, eval = F}
nano ~/workshop/r_script_name.R
```

Besides `nano` you can also use other text editors like `vim` or `vi` in case you need/want to modify files directly in the cluster
